meanings.definition: Existing or occurring before the Industrial Revolution.
meanings.sent1: The small village had a preindustrial charm with its thatched roofs and lack of machinery.
meanings.sent2: The historian studied the preindustrial society to understand life before factories and machines.
meanings.sent3: The time-traveling tourist was amazed by the preindustrial simplicity of the rural town.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a preindustrial landscape, untouched by the modern ideas of progress.
meanings.sent5: The preindustrial era was like a quiet painting, waiting to be colored by the Industrial Revolution.

meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a time before industrialization.
meanings.sent1: The preindustrial farming methods relied on manual labor and basic tools.
meanings.sent2: The preindustrial architecture of the castle reflected a time of craftsmanship and tradition.
meanings.sent3: The preindustrial fashion show featured designs inspired by historical clothing.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts wandered through the preindustrial landscapes of her ancestors.
meanings.sent5: The preindustrial world seemed like a dream, distant yet familiar in its simplicity.
